page.title: 01Tourism and Monmouth
page.content: The area is famous for its{scenery}and attracts many tourists intent on seeing the{Wye Valley.}Apart from the River Wye,there are two other rivers, the{Monnow}and{Trothy. { Farming}plays an important part in the economy of the area,and the town of Monmouth is essentially a market town. Industry is on a small scale,with only relatively few industries on the industrial estate. There are two villages,{Mitchel Troy which is growing steadily,and the much smaller village of{Wonastow. { Charles Rolls,}of{Rolls- Royce}fame, the{Nelson Museum,}and{Monmouth School are associated with the town. It is twinned with the French town Carbonne. Passing through is the busy Midlands -South Wales trunk road.
